name: Chick Peas With Spinach And Salt Cod
author: Maria Jose Sevilla
instructions: Soak the cod in water for 24 to 36 hours, depending on the thickness of the pieces, changing the water at least 3 times.
Soak the chickpeas overnight in cold water.
Slive 1 onion. Place the water, salt, sliced onion, carrot and bay leaf in a large pan and bring to a boil.
As soon as the water begins to boil, add the chick peas.
Bring back to the boil, cover and simmer gently for 2 to 3 hours until the beans are cooked, adding a little extra water if necessary.
Meanwhile, cook the spinach in a very little salted water for 3 minutes, then drain and chop.
Chop the remaining onion, heat the oil and fry the onion until golden.
Add the cod and cook, stirring continuously for 1 to 2 minutes.
When the peas are cooked, remove the bay leaf, add the cod and onion mixture and the spinach, boil for 2 minutes.
If you like a thicker soup, you can puree some of the chick peas then return them to the soup before serving.
